intro: Conyza hamiltonii, commonly known as the common horseweed, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and can be found in fields, roadsides, and other open areas. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and bloom in the summer months. Conyza hamiltonii is known for its adaptability and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
